

Preparing some figures

Darwin data can be found here: https://simonscmap.com/catalog/datasets/Darwin_Ecosystem

```{r}
library('cmap4r')
set_authorization(cmap_key = "5e05c500-d68d-11e9-9d3b-4f83fcec4710")
dat = get_spacetime(tableName = "tblCHL_REP",
                    varName = 'chl',
                    dt1='2014-03-01',
                    dt2='2014-05-2',
                    lat1=20,
                    lat2=50,
                    lon1=-170,
                    lon2=-150,
                    depth1=0,
                    depth2=100) ##%>% head(10) %>% kable()

dat_darwin = get_spacetime(tableName = "tblDarwin_Ecosystem",
                           varName = 'CHL',
                           dt1 = '2014-03-01',
                           dt2 = '2014-05-2',
                           lat1 = 20,
                           lat2 = 50,
                           lon1 = -170,
                           lon2 = -150,
                           depth1 = 0,
                           depth2 = 100) ##%>% head(10) %>% kable()

dat$time %>%  unique()
dat_darwin$time %>% unique() 

c(dat$lat %>%  unique(), dat_darwin$lat %>% unique() )

par(mfrow=c(1,2))
dat_darwin$lat %>% unique()  %>% plot()
dat$lat %>% unique()  %>% points(col='red')

dat_darwin$lat %>% unique()  %>% head(10)
dat$lat %>% unique()  %>% head(10)

cut = 0.3##0.8130424448
dat = dat %>% mutate(chl = pmin(chl, cut))
```

Okay, so this data doesn't exist on the same gridpoints, so it's kind of hard to do a comparison.

I could bin the data into a slightly coarser resolution.

I think I would probably ask Bror to do this for me though..
